intro: Anapausia aliena var. cladorrhizans, commonly known as the clustered root anapausia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clustered root system. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
